classes.name: Berserker
classes.description:
Wrath and Ruin. The Berserker is destruction. He knows not fatigue nor caution-both surely driven away from him in a relentless fury. Those of barbaric nature are said to eat only the dust of war and drink naught but the blood of those felled by their own hand.
Death is no stranger, for it is said that even death fears to take a Berserker before his battle Rage is satiated. Once a Berserker has begun to fight, he only grows stronger, fueled by battle-lust and an unending Rage. The deadliest among them is not the wellrested, but those who are pushed to the brink through combat. It matters not what a Berserker takes up, be it axe or sword; flesh will be hewn from bone and heads from shoulders. Many have caved under the Berserker's primal might-sword and spell are but straw in the wake of unbridled Rage. As a Berserker, you can:
- Become a raging, damage-dealing machine. Greet death as an old friend and keep on fighting!
- Increase your damage to unbelievable levels. The longer a fight goes on, the more your Rage intensifies, allowing you to deal out incredible amounts of brutality.
- Use your Savage Arsenal. Choose abilities to crush your foes and laugh in the face of death!

level_feats.name: Rage
level_feats.text: Roll a Fury Die (1d4) and set it aside. Add it to every STR attack you make. You can have a max of KEY Fury Dice; they are lost when your Rage ends. Your rage ends if you leave combat, drop to 0 HP, or go 1 round without attacking or Raging. You can Rage and gain another Fury Die even if you are already Raging. If you are already at your max, roll as normal and decide which ones to keep. Your Fury Dice are dice when calculating damage for monster armor.

level_feats.name: That all you got?!
level_feats.text: When you are attacked, you may expend 1 or more Fury Dice to reduce the damage taken by STR+DEX for each die spent.

level_feats.name: Intensifying Fury
level_feats.text: If you are Raging at the beginning of your turn, roll 1 Fury Die for free.

level_feats.name: One with the Ancients
level_feats.text: When faced with a decision about which direction or course of action to take, you can call upon your ancestors to guide you toward the most dangerous or challenging path.

level_feats.name: Bloodlust
level_feats.text: Expend 1 or more Fury Dice on your turn, move DEX spaces per die spent for free.

level_feats.name: Enduring Rage
level_feats.text: While Dying, you Rage automatically for free at the beginning of your turn, have a max of 2 actions instead of 1, and ignore the STR saves to make attacks.

level_feats.name: Wrath and Ruin
level_feats.text: Whenever you perform a notable act of destruction or feat of strength during a Safe Rest, you may choose different Berserker options available to you.

level_feats.name: Savage Arsenal
level_feats.text: Choose 1 ability from the Savage Arsenal.

level_feats.name: Rage (2)
level_feats.text: Whenever you Rage, gain 2 Fury Dice instead.

level_feats.name: Intensifying Fury (2)
level_feats.text: Your Fury Dice are now d6s.

level_feats.name: Intensifying Fury (3)
level_feats.text: Your Fury Dice are now d8s.

level_feats.name: Intensifying Fury (4)
level_feats.text: Your Fury Dice are now d10s.

level_feats.name: Intensifying Fury (5)
level_feats.text: Your Fury Dice are now d12s.

level_feats.name: DEEP RAGE
level_feats.text: Dropping to 0 HP does not cause your Rage to end.

level_feats.name: Epic Boon
level_feats.text: Choose an Epic Boon (see pg. 23 of the GM's Guide).

level_feats.name: BOUNDLESS RAGE.
level_feats.text: +1 to any 2 of your stats. Anytime you roll less than 6 on a Fury Die, change it to 6 instead.

Savage Arsenal.name: Death Blow
Savage Arsenal.text: After you deal damage from a crit, you may expend any number of Fury Dice. Sum the dice and deal double that amount of damage.

Savage Arsenal.name: Deathless Rage
Savage Arsenal.text: While Dying, you may suffer 1 Wound to gain 1 action.

Savage Arsenal.name: Eager for Battle
Savage Arsenal.text: Gain advantage on Initiative. Move 2xDEX spaces for free on your first turn each encounter.

Savage Arsenal.name: Into the Fray
Savage Arsenal.text: Leap up to 2xDEX spaces toward an enemy. If you land adjacent to at least 2 enemies, make an attack against 1 of them for free.

Savage Arsenal.name: Mighty Endurance
Savage Arsenal.text: You can now survive an additional 4 Wounds before death.

Savage Arsenal.name: MORE BLOOD!
Savage Arsenal.text: Whenever an enemy crits you, gain 1 Fury Die.

Savage Arsenal.name: Rampage
Savage Arsenal.text: After you land a hit, you may treat your next attack this turn as if you rolled that same amount instead of rolling again.

Savage Arsenal.name: Swift Fury
Savage Arsenal.text: Whenever you gain one or more Fury Dice, move up to DEX spaces for free, ignoring difficult terrain.

Savage Arsenal.name: Thunderous Steps
Savage Arsenal.text: After moving at least 4 spaces while Raging, you may deal STR Bludgeoning damage to all adjacent creatures where you stop.

Savage Arsenal.name: Unstoppable Force
Savage Arsenal.text: While Dying and Raging, taking damage causes 1 Wound (instead of 2) and critical hits inflict 2 Wounds (instead of 3).

Savage Arsenal.name: Whirlwind
Savage Arsenal.text: Attack ALL targets within your melee weapon's reach.

Savage Arsenal.name: You're Next!
Savage Arsenal.text: While Raging, you can make a Might skill check to demoralize an enemy within Reach 12 (DC: their current HP). On a success, they immediately flee the battle.

subclass_feats.name: Stone's Resilience
subclass_feats.text: Whenever you expend Fury Dice to reduce incoming damage, add the value of the die to the amount reduced.

subclass_feats.name: Mountainous Tenacity
subclass_feats.text: Whenever you expend your Hit Dice to recover HP, for every 10 HP you would recover, you may heal 1 Wound instead.

subclass_feats.name: Unbreakable
subclass_feats.text: While Raging, if you would suffer your last Wound or other negative condition of your choice, you don't.

subclass_feats.name: Titan's Fury
subclass_feats.text: After you miss an attack or are crit by an enemy, Rage for free.

subclass_feats.name: Mountain's Endurance
subclass_feats.text: While Dying, if an attack against you would be a crit, the attack is rerolled instead (when-crit abilities, such as Titan's Fury, still trigger).

subclass_feats.name: Blood Frenzy
subclass_feats.text: While Raging, whenever you crit or kill an enemy, change 1 Fury Die to the maximum.

subclass_feats.name: Savage Awareness
subclass_feats.text: Advantage on Perception checks to notice or track down blood. Blindsight 2 while Raging: you ignore the Blinded condition and can see through darkness and Invisibility within that Range.

subclass_feats.name: Unstoppable Brutality
subclass_feats.text: While Raging, you may gain 1 Wound to reroll any attack or save.

subclass_feats.name: Opportunistic Frenzy
subclass_feats.text: While Raging, you can make opportunity attacks without disadvantage, and you may make them whenever an enemy enters your melee weapon's reach.

subclass_feats.name: Onslaught
subclass_feats.text: While Raging, gain +2 speed. (1/round) you may move for free.

classes.name: The Cheat
classes.description:
Cloak and dagger… and dagger. The common Cheat doesn't call herself a Cheat, of course—rather, a streetsmart rogue, a survivalist, or a liberator of unused goods. They are masters of stealth, pickpocketing, and smooth talking. Some of the more vicious ilk are masters of death-dealing as well.
Cheats can be found in every city and byway under countless different names, but they all believe something similar: It's a cruel, merciless world, and those who aim to survive don't have time for silly things like 'morals' or 'honor.' Those are luxuries of the rich and powerful. Honor gets you killed—survival is about taking what you want, when you can. As The Cheat, you can:
- Break the rules! You can change the dice you roll to whatever numbers suit you best!
- Sneak in and backstab enemies with devastating critical hits, taking down even huge, heavily-armored foes with a single blow!
- Fight dirty with pocket sand, low blows, and vicious blades. When things get out of hand, disappear into the night, and live to cheat another day!

level_feats.name: Vicious Opportunist
level_feats.text: When you hit a Distracted target with a melee attack, you may change the Primary Die roll to whatever you like (changing it to the max value counts as a crit). Distracted. A target is Distracted if it is adjacent to or Taunted by an ally, or if it cannot see you.

level_feats.name: Cheat
level_feats.text:
You're a well-rounded cheater. Gain the following abilities:
- (1/round) You may either Move or Hide for free.
- (1/day) You may change any skill check to 10+INT.
- If you roll less than 10 on Initiative, you may change it to 10 instead.
- You may gain advantage on skill checks while playing any games, competitions, or placing wagers. If you're caught though…

level_feats.name: Thieves' Cant
level_feats.text: You learn the secret language of rogues and scoundrels.

level_feats.name: Twist the Blade
level_feats.text: Change one of your Sneak Attack dice to whatever you like.

level_feats.name: Quick Read
level_feats.text:
-(1/encounter) Gain advantage on an Assess check.
-(1/day) Gain advantage on an Examination check.

level_feats.name: THAT'S Not What Happened!
level_feats.text: After a Distracted enemy attacks you, you may change the Primary Die roll to whatever you like (changing the die to the minimum value counts as a miss).

level_feats.name: Twist the Blade (2)
level_feats.text: You can Twist the Blade for free.

level_feats.name: Epic Boon
level_feats.text: Choose an Epic Boon (see pg. 23 of the GM's Guide).

level_feats.name: Supreme Execution
level_feats.text: +1 to any 2 of your stats. When you attack with a blade, you do not require targets to be Distracted to trigger Vicious Opportunist.

Underhanded Abilities.name: 'Creative' Accounting
Underhanded Abilities.text: Steal up to INT actions from your next turn (Gain up to INT actions now. The next time you would gain actions, subtract the number stolen). You cannot use this 2 turns in a row.

Underhanded Abilities.name: Exploit Weakness
Underhanded Abilities.text: Make a contested INT check against an enemy. If you win, you can use Vicious Opportunist against them, even if they are not Distracted. This lasts for 1 minute or until you use this ability against another target.

Underhanded Abilities.name: Feinting Attack
Underhanded Abilities.text: If you miss for the 2nd time in a single round, you may change the primary die roll to any result instead.

Underhanded Abilities.name: How'd YOU get here?!
Underhanded Abilities.text: 'Teleport' up to 4 spaces away, adjacent to a Distracted target, and make a melee attack against them. If you crit, you may "teleport" again.

Underhanded Abilities.name: I'm Outta Here!
Underhanded Abilities.text: When an ally within 4 spaces is crit, you may turn invisible until the end of your next turn and then move up to half your speed for free.

Underhanded Abilities.name: Misdirection
Underhanded Abilities.text: Gain INT armor. Whenever you Defend, you may halve the damage instead.

Underhanded Abilities.name: Steal Tempo
Underhanded Abilities.text: When you land a critical hit for the second time on a turn, your target loses 1 action and you gain 1 action.

Underhanded Abilities.name: Sunder Armor (Medium)
Underhanded Abilities.text: When you crit an enemy with medium armor, sunder their armor. Until the start of your next turn, ALL melee attacks against that target ignore its armor.

Underhanded Abilities.name: Sunder Armor (Heavy)
Underhanded Abilities.text: Req. Sunder Armor (Medium). Your Sunder Armor ability now also applies to enemies wearing heavy armor.

Underhanded Abilities.name: Trickshot
Underhanded Abilities.text: When you throw a dagger, it returns back to your hand at the end of your turn. On a hit, it ricochets to another creature within 2 spaces, dealing half as much damage to them.

subclass_feats.name: Amidst All This Commotion…
subclass_feats.text: If a creature dies while you Sneak Attack them, you may turn Invisible until you attack again or until the beginning of your next turn.

subclass_feats.name: Leave No Trace
subclass_feats.text: Advantage on Stealth checks when you are at full health.

subclass_feats.name: Cunning Strike
subclass_feats.text: When you land a Sneak Attack, you may force the target to make a STR save (DC 10+INT). On a failure, instead of rolling your Sneak Attack dice, they deal the maximum amount of damage (if your target saves, regain 1 use).

subclass_feats.name: Professional Skulker
subclass_feats.text: Gain a climbing speed and advantage on Stealth checks (replaces Leave No Trace).

subclass_feats.name: KILL.
subclass_feats.text: When you crit an enemy with fewer max HP than you, it dies.

subclass_feats.name: Low Blow
subclass_feats.text: When you Sneak Attack, you may spend 2 additional actions to Incapacitate your target for their next turn on a failed STR save (DC 10+INT). Save or fail, they are Taunted by you until you drop to 0 HP.

subclass_feats.name: Sweet Talk
subclass_feats.text: You may gain advantage on all Influence checks with NPCs you've just met for the first time. This lasts until you fail an Influence check with them or until you meet a 2nd time. You have disadvantage on Influence checks with them after you use this ability (until you get back on their good side).

subclass_feats.name: Pocket Sand
subclass_feats.text: When you Defend against a melee attack, Blind the attacker until the start of their next turn and force them to reroll the attack (Blinded creatures attack with disadvantage).

subclass_feats.name: Escape Plan
subclass_feats.text: When you would drop to 0 HP or gain a Wound, you don't. Instead, you turn Invisible for 1 minute or until you attack.

subclass_feats.name: Heads I Win, Tails You Lose
subclass_feats.text: Attacks you make this round don't miss, you crit on 1 less than normally needed, and you gain LVL temp HP.

classes.name: Commander
classes.description:
Soldier… Warrior… Fearless Leader. Among the most skilled soldiers in the world, Commanders are masters of every weapon and form of close combat. A small cohort of soldiers led by a trained Commander is more feared than innumerable legions without one.
An 'empire' isn't an Empire until they have their own academy of command: Famed schools where these supremely capable soldiers are trained in battlefield tactics and leadership. Commanders are defined by their:
- Tactical Commands. Issue powerful orders to your allies, bolstering their abilities, and coordinate devastating strikes among yourselves. Command the battlefield with precision and skill, turning the tide of any battle in your favor.
- Weapon Mastery. Exert mastery over all weapon types, wielding them with deadly efficiency. Your versatility ensures victory against any foe.
- Strategic Leadership. Exploit your tactical prowess to outwit and outmaneuver foes, leading your party to triumph through cunning strategy and decisive action.

level_feats.name: Coordinated Strike!
level_feats.text: Gain the Coordinated Strike! Commander's Order.

level_feats.name: Field Medic
level_feats.text: Roll 1 additional die for any health potion you administer. Whenever you or an ally spends any number of Hit Dice to recover HP, if you spent at least ten minutes examining their wounds, they can add your Examination bonus to the HP recovered.

level_feats.name: Fit for Any Battlefield
level_feats.text: Choose a Combat Tactic. When you roll Initiative, gain STR Combat Dice, each a d6. (1/attack) You may expend a Combat Die to perform a special maneuver. Combat Dice are lost when combat ends.

level_feats.name: Master Commander
level_feats.text: When you roll Initiative, regain 1 spent use of Coordinated Strike (it is lost if not spent during that encounter). Attacks made from your Coordinated Strikes also now ignore disadvantage.

level_feats.name: Combat Tactics
level_feats.text: Your Combat Dice are now d8s.

level_feats.name: Fit for Any Battlefield (2)
level_feats.text: Choose another Combat Ability (Commander's Order) or gain +1 max Combat Dice.

level_feats.name: Weapon Mastery
level_feats.text: You may sheathe a weapon and draw a different one 2x/round for free. Choose a weapon type to specialize in.

level_feats.name: Fit for Any Battlefield (3)
level_feats.text: Choose another Combat Ability (Commander's Order) or gain +1 max Combat Dice.

level_feats.name: Combat Tactics (2)
level_feats.text: Your Combat Dice are now d10s.

level_feats.name: Fit for Any Battlefield (4)
level_feats.text: Choose another Combat Ability (Commander's Order) or gain +1 max Combat Dice.

level_feats.name: Weapon Mastery (2)
level_feats.text: Choose a 2nd weapon type to specialize in.

level_feats.name: Fit for Any Battlefield (5)
level_feats.text: Choose another Combat Ability (Commander's Order) or gain +1 max Combat Dice.

level_feats.name: Combat Tactics (3)
level_feats.text: Your Combat Dice are now d12s.

level_feats.name: Weapon Mastery (3)
level_feats.text: You have complete mastery of all weapon types.

level_feats.name: Fit for Any Battlefield (6)
level_feats.text: Choose another Combat Ability (Commander's Order) or gain +1 max Combat Dice.

level_feats.name: Combat Tactics (4)
level_feats.text: Your Combat Dice are now d20s.

level_feats.name: Unparalleled Tactics
level_feats.text: The first time each encounter you use Coordinated Strike, an ally who can hear you also gains 1 action to use on their next turn.

level_feats.name: Epic Boon
level_feats.text: Choose an Epic Boon (see pg. 23 of the GM's Guide).

level_feats.name: Captain of Legions
level_feats.text: +1 to any 2 of your stats. The first time each encounter you use Coordinated Strike, EVERY ally within 12 spaces gains +1 action (replaces Unparalleled Tactics).

Commander's Orders.name: Coordinated Strike!
Commander's Orders.text: You and an ally within 6 spaces both immediately make a weapon attack or cast a cantrip for free. You can do this INT times/Safe Rest.

Commander's Orders.name: Face Me!
Commander's Orders.text: Trigger: After an ally is crit within 12 spaces. Taunt that enemy until you drop to 0 HP.

Commander's Orders.name: Hold the Line!
Commander's Orders.text: Trigger: When an ally drops to 0 HP. Command them to continue the fight! Set their HP to 3x your LVL.

Commander's Orders.name: I Can Do This ALL DAY!
Commander's Orders.text: Trigger: When you would drop to 0 HP. You may expend any number of Hit Dice and set your HP to the sum rolled instead (do not add your STR).

Commander's Orders.name: Move it! Move it!
Commander's Orders.text: When you roll Initiative you may give yourself and an ally advantage on the roll and +3 speed for 1 round.

Commander's Orders.name: Reposition!
Commander's Orders.text: Used on an ally's turn: Command 1 ally to move up to their speed (or 2 allies up to half their speed) for free.

Combat Tactics.name: Commanding Presence
Combat Tactics.text: Shout a command up to 2 words long at an enemy. On a failed WIL save (DC 10+STR), they must spend their entire next turn obeying it to the best of their ability, provided it is not obviously harmful to themselves. They then become immune to this effect for 1 day.

Combat Tactics.name: Heavy Strike
Combat Tactics.text: When you hit, push a Medium creature STR spaces and deal extra damage equal to a roll of your Combat Die. A Small creature is pushed twice as far; Large, pushed half as far (round down).

Combat Tactics.name: Inerrant Strike
Combat Tactics.text: Reroll a missed attack, add 1 to the Primary Die, and deal extra damage equal to a roll of your Combat Die.

Combat Tactics.name: Lunging Strike
Combat Tactics.text: Gain +1 Reach on an attack and deal extra damage equal to 2x a roll of your Combat Die.

Combat Tactics.name: Sweeping Strike
Combat Tactics.text: Select any contiguous area within your weapon's Reach and damage ALL targets there. This attack does not miss on a 1.

Arcane Command.name: Arcane Command
Arcane Command.text: Your focus on the arcane causes you to lose access to Weapon Mastery and Combat Tactics, but you now gain INT mana when you roll Initiative (this mana is lost if unspent when combat ends). Whenever you could choose a Combat Tactic or Weapon Mastery, instead choose another Commander's Order or a tier 1 (or lower) spell from any spell school. Your Commander's Orders are also empowered with magical power (see below).

Arcane Command.name: Face Me! (Glimmering Decree)
Arcane Command.text: Trigger: after an ally within 12 spaces is crit. That enemy takes STR d8 radiant damage (ignoring armor), is pulled up to 4 spaces toward you, and is Taunted by you until you drop to 0 HP.

Arcane Command.name: Move it! Move it! (Borne upon the Wind)
Arcane Command.text: When you roll Initiative, you may give yourself and an ally advantage on the roll, +3 speed, and the ability to fly for 1 round. Then, you both can also move for free.

Arcane Command.name: Hold the Line! (Crystalline Armor)
Arcane Command.text: Trigger: when an ally drops to 0 HP. Command them to continue the fight! Set their HP to 3x your LVL. Additionally, they gain that many temp HP. Enemies who reduce this temp HP in melee have their speed halved until the end of their next turn.

Arcane Command.name: Reposition! (Flashstep)
Arcane Command.text: Used on an ally's turn: Command 1 ally to move up to their speed (or 2 allies up to half their speed) for free. You may exchange places with one of them.

Arcane Command.name: I Can Do This ALL DAY! (Rising Phoenix)
Arcane Command.text: Trigger: when you would drop to 0 HP. You may expend any number of Hit Dice, set your HP to the sum rolled instead, and deal that much fire damage to each enemy within 2 spaces of you. They gain the Smoldering condition.

Arcane Command.name: Coordinated Strike! (Withering Strike)
Arcane Command.text: Any attacks made this way deal additional Necrotic damage equal to the max value of your Combat Die. An enemy damaged this way is considered undead for 1 round.

Weapon Mastery.name: Slashing
Weapon Mastery.text: Your attacks with slashing weapons cannot miss unarmored enemies.

Weapon Mastery.name: Bludgeoning
Weapon Mastery.text: When your primary die rolls a 7 or higher with a bludgeoning weapon, ignore Heavy Armor.

Weapon Mastery.name: Piercing
Weapon Mastery.text: Your attacks with piercing weapons ignore Medium Armor.

subclass_feats.name: Armor Master
subclass_feats.text: You are proficient with plate armor.

subclass_feats.name: Shield Expert
subclass_feats.text: While wearing a shield, you may Defend 2x each round. The first time each round you block all of the damage from an attack, you may make an opportunity attack against the attacker for free.

subclass_feats.name: Juggernaut
subclass_feats.text: When you use Coordinated Strike, you deal extra damage equal to your armor, and you can add 1 to your primary die.

subclass_feats.name: Taunting Strike
subclass_feats.text: You may Taunt a creature you hit until the end of their next turn.

subclass_feats.name: Shield Wall
subclass_feats.text: Allies within 2 spaces gain ALL the benefits of the shield you have equipped.

subclass_feats.name: Advance!
subclass_feats.text: After you move toward an enemy, gain advantage on the first melee attack you make against it. When you use your Coordinated Strike, you and all allies within 12 spaces can first move up to half their speed for free.

subclass_feats.name: Experienced Commander
subclass_feats.text: Your Coordinated Strike may target 1 additional ally. Gain +1 use of Coordinated Strike/Safe Rest.

subclass_feats.name: Survey the Battlefield
subclass_feats.text: When you roll Initiative, regain 1 use of Coordinated Strike. +1 max Combat Dice.

subclass_feats.name: As One!
subclass_feats.text: Attacks made with your Coordinated Strike also grant advantage and ignore all disadvantage. Your chosen allies gain 1 additional action to use on their next turn.

subclass_feats.name: Firebrand
subclass_feats.text: When you roll Initiative you may cast Enchant Weapon for free (can be upcast as normal by spending additional mana).

subclass_feats.name: Deep Knowledge (1)
subclass_feats.text: Choose any tier 1 (or lower) spell and any Utility Spell.

subclass_feats.name: Deep Knowledge (2)
subclass_feats.text: Choose any tier 2 (or lower) spell and any Utility Spell.

subclass_feats.name: Deep Knowledge (3)
subclass_feats.text: Choose any tier 3 (or lower) spell and any Utility Spell.

subclass_feats.name: Deep Knowledge (4)
subclass_feats.text: Choose any tier 4 (or lower) spell and any Utility Spell.

classes.name: Hunter
classes.description:
Respect the forest and her children, and she will bestow upon you many gifts. Long before the first stones of the grand kingdoms had been laid, there was The Wild. We Hunters called groves and fields home, just as the elk and boar still do. We have trained our minds and hearts as much as we have trained with bows.
For, there is great danger in becoming a Hunter: the intoxicating Thrill of the Hunt that washes over your body when stalking prey. Be warned—do not allow it to settle into your heart. For no true Hunter takes without recognizing what they have first been given: a soul, a meal… warmth, all at a cost—a life. And that should not be taken lightly. Wherever you roam, be it city or glade, mountain or valley, as long as The Wild is tenderly tucked into the depths of your heart, you will always be a Hunter. May your arrows strike true and your bowstrings never break.
Hunters are:
- Relentless Trackers. As an expert survivalist, you mark your prey, becoming a shadow in pursuit, relentless and precise.
- Masters of the Wild. Harness the Thrill of the Hunt to outwit your targets—set decoys, spring traps, and strike with lethal efficiency.
- Deadly from Afar or Up Close. Whether you're raining arrows from a distance or closing in for a personal takedown, your prey won't escape your reach.

level_feats.name: Hunter's Mark
level_feats.text: A creature you can see is marked as your quarry for 1 day (or until you mark another creature). It can't be hidden from you, and your attacks against it gain your choice of advantage OR +LVL damage (choose before each attack).

level_feats.name: Forager
level_feats.text: Gain advantage on skill checks to find food and water in the wild.

level_feats.name: Thrill of the Hunt
level_feats.text: Choose 2 Thrill of the Hunt (TotH) abilities. Gain a charge to use these abilities during that encounter whenever: Your quarry dies, or you hit your quarry in melee or crit your quarry at range. Note: Unless otherwise noted, each Thrill of the Hunt ability costs 1 charge to use and cannot miss. Abilities that spend charges cannot generate new ones. Unused charges are lost when combat ends.

level_feats.name: Roll and Strike
level_feats.text: If you have no Thrill of the Hunt charges, move up to your speed toward your quarry. If you end adjacent to them, make a melee attack against them for free.

level_feats.name: Tracker's Intuition
level_feats.text: You can discern the events of a past encounter by studying tracks and other subtle environmental clues, accurately determining the kind and amount of creatures, their direction, key actions, and passage of time.

level_feats.name: Thrill of the Hunt (2)
level_feats.text: Choose a 3rd Thrill of the Hunt ability.

level_feats.name: Hunter's Resolve
level_feats.text: Whenever you have no Thrill of the Hunt charges, gain Hunter's Resolve until the end of your turn: treat all creatures as your quarry for the purposes of movement and melee attacks.

level_feats.name: Final Takedown
level_feats.text: Spend 1 Thrill of the Hunt charge to make a melee attack against your Bloodied quarry. Turn it into a crit and double the damage of your Hunter's Mark. If they survive, they crit you back.

level_feats.name: Versatile Bowmaster
level_feats.text: Whenever you attack with a Longbow, you may roll 2d4 instead of 1d8; or with a Crossbow, 2d8 instead of 4d4.

level_feats.name: Thrill of the Hunt (3)
level_feats.text: Choose a 4th Thrill of the Hunt ability.

level_feats.name: Thrill of the Hunt (4)
level_feats.text: Choose a 5th Thrill of the Hunt ability.

level_feats.name: No Escape
level_feats.text: Whenever you see one or more allies make an opportunity attack, you may also make a ranged opportunity attack against the same target.

level_feats.name: Veteran Stalker
level_feats.text: Gain a Thrill of the Hunt charge whenever you are first Bloodied in an encounter and for every Wound you gain.

level_feats.name: Keen Eye, Steady Hand
level_feats.text: Add WIL to your ranged weapon damage.

level_feats.name: Thrill of the Hunt (5)

classes.name: Mage
classes.description:
Elemental power flows through all things… find it, study it, and harness it. A mage is bestowed their first strand of the Tapestry at birth; however, true mastery eludes those who idly rest upon this innate endowment. Instead, they diligently refine their natural gifts through scholarly pursuit, with tomes and parchments as their companions, alongside the sage counsel of a seasoned mentor or three! Yes, this is the chosen path of those who would wield authority over the elements.
Comprehending the tapestry of mana is no trivial endeavor—it will yield its arcane secrets only to the earnest seeker of knowledge. Yet, once the adept learns to discern the subtleties of its intricate patterns as it unfurls and meanders into the ethereal expanse—it is in that moment the apprentice truly ascends to the mantle of mage.
Mages are:
- Spellshaper. Customize the spells you cast: stretch time, gain extra-dimensional vision, or echo cast multiple spells!
- Elemental Mastery. Harness the power of the elements, whether raining down fire from the heavens, freezing enemies in their tracks, or striking with thunderous bolts of lightning.
- Chaos or Control. Will you snatch control of the frayed tapestry of mana or lean into the forces of chaos? What awaits you… Diamond Skin? Elemental Entanglement? Liquefy Legs?

classes.description:
I will protect my companions and vanquish evil at all costs. Various orders of these zealous, holy warriors have attained great physical and radiant strength through absolute devotion to a higher power in the form of oaths. Through their strength, both physical and radiant, nothing can sway them from their hunger for justice and their fervent pursuit and hatred of evil.
The mark of a true Oathsworn, however, is their willingness to lay down their life for their friends.
Oathsworn can:
- Defend with Devotion. Shield your allies from harm and channel righteous judgment. The more you face evil, the more potent your strikes become.
- Divinely Protect. Stand as a bastion of defense, safeguarding allies even from afar. Your presence brings justice to every corner of the realm.
- Shine as a Beacon of Virtue. Mend wounds, discern truth from ill intent, and inspire others to embrace your noble cause with unwavering conviction.

classes.name: Shadowmancer
classes.description:
Totally NOT evil. Why would you even say that? Great power sometimes comes from… horrible places. But what's the alternative, spend our entire lives… STUDYING?! Now that's horrible. Who'd want to waste their lives reading books—learning magic the hard way? Work SMART, not hard. Just scheme up a way to take what you need from someone who won't miss it—ancient horrors don't guard their power nearly as well as you'd think! And if there's power just laying around, it'd be dumb of me to not use it, really.
So what if I wear black and have to occasionally sacrifice an animal here and there while chanting? Does that automatically mean I'm evil? Pfft, hardly! Not every ANCIENT HORROR is the same; that's like saying crow black and spider black are the same. Okay, bad examples, but the point stands. If you're tired of swinging swords around and getting sweaty like a peasant, just summon a horde of shadow minions to do your bidding. They're always eager to serve!
As a Shadowmancer:
- Unspeakable Power Awaits. Use your cunning to forge pacts with ancient, unfathomable entities, drawing upon their incomprehensible power to crush foes and bend the shadows to your will.
- Master Shadow Minions. Summon legions of shadowy minions to overwhelm your adversaries and bolster your magical abilities. Let them swarm your foes, serving as both sword and fodder in your quest for dominance.

classes.name: Shepherd
classes.description:
Let all who are afflicted come. I will mend thy bones and soothe thy wounds. Thou shalt revere the gifts of life and death, neither of which is ever given or taken. Rather, we are all souls merely journeying between this realm and that of the beyond. But alas, often do these wandering souls find themselves bereft of guidance. Thus falls upon the Shepherd the solemn duty—to be a beacon of light to those ensnared in darkness, and darkness to those who, in hubris, deem themselves to be the light.
For many, the journey of service is a difficult path—yet, in this task we are not solitary. Our Lifebinding Spirits, the steadfast companions of our faith, are bound beside us, comforting and aiding us in the stewardship we've been given.
As a Shepherd, you:
- Embrace the Balance. Embody the forces of Life and Death, wielding spells from your chosen domains. As you walk the path of balance, ponder which way the scales shall tip: towards healing or harm?
- Lead a Faithful Companion. Summon a Lifebinding spirit to your side, providing invaluable support in battle. Whether bolstering allies with healing or smiting foes with righteous fury, your spirit companion stands ready to aid in the struggle.

Upcasting: Increment its die size by 1 (max d12), +1 healing use.
Note: You and your companion use the same action pool, but count as different creatures. So you can each attack once without Rushed Attacks every round.

classes.name: Songweaver
classes.description:
Just TRY and resist my charm… wait—NO, don't! Each Songweaver holds a spark granted to them by a muse at birth; a spark which fuels their creative energy and flows forth in the form of a sharp wit, relentless humor, or moving art.
The power of a Songweaver's spark is also evident in their powerful sway over others. Songweavers can bolster and infuse courage in their allies, or… make their enemies' brains leak out through their ears. The Songweaver can bring a whole new meaning to verbal abuse! They can even redirect the (often justified) attacks of others, in order to protect their own moneymakers.
As a Songweaver, you can:
- Charm the hapless people you meet and inspire your allies to reach fantastic new heights of heroism!
- Use your Lyrical Weaponry and powerful charisma to dominate enemies and call special friends to aid you in your journeys and battles. You can even redirect attacks away from yourself and make enemies attack their own allies!
- Control the Battlefield with a chord of chaos, a rad heroic ballad, or a debilitating rhapsody; make your allies and enemies alike dance to your tune!

classes.name: Stormshifter
classes.description:
The trees whisper their excitement, the clouds sing with glee. Rejoice! The Master of Storm and Fang arrives. All who would seek passage through the ancient grove, heed this warning: Do not provoke the forest or its inhabitants. Beseech for passage humbly, even if its guardian is unseen, rest assured that you … are not.
 Those who traverse the woodlands may feel the vigilant gaze of a Stormshifter upon them. Legend speaks of an ancient union between mortal and dryad, birthing beings capable of wielding lightning and tempests as others wield blade and shield. This is but half the tale.
 Wanderers recount encounters with beings, some wise and benevolent, others fearsome, with claws that sparked with lightning and pelts sharp as daggers. They are as one with storm and beast, embodying the serene beauty and raw power of nature's grace. As a Stormshifter, you can:
 - Aid your allies in whatever role is most needed.
 - Wade into the fray as a shapeshifted beast ranging from friendly to vicious, indomitable, or HORRIBLE.
 - Cast powerful spells from a distance to strike down, control, mend, and more.

Direbeast Forms.name: Fearsome Beast
Direbeast Forms.text:
(Large) Transform into any Large beast. Gain DEX+LVL temp HP (until Beastshift ends), the Gore attack, and Fearsome.
 - Gore. Action. 1d6+LVL damage, on hit: Gain LVL temp HP.
 - Fearsome. Whenever you Interpose or Defend, you may spend 1 mana to force them to reroll the attack (you must choose either result).

Direbeast Forms.name: Beast of the Pack
Direbeast Forms.text:
(Medium) Transform into a Medium beast. Gain +DEX speed, Supercharge, and the Thunderfang attack. Whenever you crit or kill one or more enemies, Thunderfang gains a cumulative +1d4 lightning damage until combat ends.
 - Thunderfang. Action. 1d4+LVL piercing damage.
 - Supercharge. Spend up to WIL mana, and your next Thunderfang attack deals an additional 1d8 lightning damage per mana spent (you take this damage on a miss).

Direbeast Forms.name: Beast of Nightmares
Direbeast Forms.text:
(Tiny) Transform into any Tiny beast or insect (provided it is horrible). Gain the Sting attack and Silent But Deadly.
 - Sting. Action. 1/round. Reach: 0. 1d4 piercing + 3xLVL acid damage (ignoring armor), on crit: 4xLVL damage instead.
 - Silent But Deadly. Speed: 2. You cannot Defend or Interpose. Attackers cannot target you until you become conspicuous (e.g., being seen transforming or attacking).
 Whenever you shapeshift into a Tiny beast, attacks against you are made with disadvantage, but ANY damage ends that shapeshift form.

Chimeric Boons.name: Beast of the Sea
Chimeric Boons.text: Can move, breathe, and fight underwater without penalty.

Chimeric Boons.name: Climber
Chimeric Boons.text: Can walk across walls and ceilings; ignores difficult terrain.

Chimeric Boons.name: Fleet Footed
Chimeric Boons.text: +2 speed. Advantage on Stealth checks and against the Grappled condition.

Chimeric Boons.name: Earthwalker
Chimeric Boons.text: +2 armor. Can burrow through dirt and unworked rock at half speed (leaving a tunnel behind). Advantage against the Prone condition.

Chimeric Boons.name: Keen Senses
Chimeric Boons.text: Advantage on Perception and Assess checks. Unaffected by Blinded.

Chimeric Boons.name: Leader of the Pack
Chimeric Boons.text: Advantage against fear and charm effects for yourself and allies within 6 spaces.

Chimeric Boons.name: Phasebeast
Chimeric Boons.text: Whenever you shift between this form and your normal form (and vice versa), you may teleport up to 6 spaces away to a place you can see.

Chimeric Boons.name: Prehensile Tail
Chimeric Boons.text: Creatures you hit in melee that are your size or smaller are Grappled. If you hit a larger creature, you may move with it when it moves.

Chimeric Boons.name: Winged
Chimeric Boons.text: Gain a flying speed. Forced movement moves you twice as far while flying.

subclass_feats.name: Deepening Study
subclass_feats.text: Choose the Ice or Radiant school to learn.

subclass_feats.name: Creature of the Fey
subclass_feats.text: You may cast spells while Beastshifted.

subclass_feats.name: Attuned to Nature
subclass_feats.text: Add LVL to any skill check related to nature or weather.

subclass_feats.name: Raging Tempest
subclass_feats.text: Whenever you crit with a tiered spell, you may cast a cantrip for free from a school you know and haven't cast any spells from this turn (at the same level of dis/advantage).

subclass_feats.name: Primordial Force
subclass_feats.text:
Spending 2+ mana on a spell grants an additional effect based on school:
- Ice: Gain WIL temp HP.
- Lightning: Deal additional damage equal to your WIL.
- Radiant: You may heal a creature within 6 spaces WIL HP.
- Wind: Gain a flying speed this turn. Move up to 6 spaces for free.

subclass_feats.name: Master of Storm
subclass_feats.text: You can concentrate on 1 lightning spell and 1 wind spell at the same time. You can cast Ride the Lightning for 0 mana.

subclass_feats.name: Swiftshift
subclass_feats.text: When you roll Initiative, you may Beastshift or move for free. While transformed, you may shift between different Direbeast forms for free (and as a reaction by spending 1 mana); however, Beastshifting for free does not grant any temp HP.

subclass_feats.name: Windborne Protector
subclass_feats.text: Trigger: when an enemy attacks. Spend 2 mana to shift into a Fearsome Beast. Then you may Interpose from up to 12 spaces away and Defend for free (if you have not yet done so this round).

subclass_feats.name: Friend of Beasts
subclass_feats.text: Beasts will not attack you until you first harm them. You may transform into harmless beasts without spending a Beastshift charge.

subclass_feats.name: Unleash the Beast
subclass_feats.text: When you miss, you can crit instead.

subclass_feats.name: Storm Wake
subclass_feats.text: Spend 3 mana to shift into a Beast of the Pack, then teleport in a straight line up to 12 spaces away, unerringly dealing WIL d8 lightning damage to any creatures you choose adjacent to your path.

subclass_feats.name: Master of Forms
subclass_feats.text: Your shapeshift forms can have 2 Chimeric Boons at a time.

subclass_feats.name: Venomous Gaze
subclass_feats.text: Spend 2 mana to shift into a Beast of Nightmares. Then entice a creature within 12 spaces to move 2xWIL spaces closer to you on a failed WIL save (they roll with disadvantage and must repeat until they save or can move no further). If they end up in the same space as you, you may Sting them for free.

subclass_feats.name: Master of Forms (2)
subclass_feats.text: You can Beastshift 2 additional times per Safe Rest. Choose 2 additional Chimeric Boons. Your Direbeast forms can have 3 at a time.

classes.name: Zephyr
classes.description:
A Zephyr dedicates their life to the relentless pursuit of kinetic perfection. They hone their bodies into blurs of motion, training from a young age in remote wilds or mountain monasteries, wielding speed to unleash blows that echo through their foes and slip past attacks like a whispering wind. Speed is both their weapon and shield.
Through ceaseless training, they harness their inner momentum to achieve feats of supernatural agility, executing every motion with flowing precision.
The Zephyr is:
- Unarmed and Dangerous. When unarmed and unarmored, you're a relentless force on the battlefield. Absorb blows and deliver devastating strikes, leaving foes in awe of your tenacity and speed.
- A Graceful Combatant. Move with unparalleled speed and determination, outpacing your allies and foes alike. Seize the initiative and strike swiftly, ensuring you're always at the forefront of combat. Your reflexes allow you to retaliate with precision and turn enemy strikes into opportunities for devastating counterattacks.

level_feats.name: Iron Defense
level_feats.text: Your armor equals DEX+STR as long as you are unarmored.

level_feats.name: Swift Fists
level_feats.text: Your unarmed strikes are not subject to disadvantage imposed by Rushed Attacks, and their damage is 1d4+STR.

level_feats.name: Swift Feet
level_feats.text: While unarmored, gain +2 speed and +LVL Initiative.

level_feats.name: Burst of Speed
level_feats.text:
When you roll Initiative, gain DEX Bursts of Speed to use during that encounter. (1/turn) You may spend 1 Burst of Speed to use any of the following maneuvers for free:
- Slipstream. Defend, and the attack misses.
- Whirling Defense. Defend and apply your armor to every attack this round.
- Swiftstrike. Attack on your turn, and ignore disadvantage from Rushed Attacks.
- Windstep. Move on your turn, ignoring difficult terrain.

level_feats.name: Kinetic Momentum
level_feats.text: Whenever you gain a Wound, gain a Burst of Speed.

level_feats.name: Ethereal Projection
level_feats.text: By meditating for at least 10 minutes, you can project an ethereal version of yourself up to 30 ft. away, passing through solid objects or barriers. You see through your projection's eyes, and it is visible to other creatures as a translucent version of yourself. It cannot interact physically with the environment but can move freely within the distance limit and lasts for up to 10 minutes.

level_feats.name: Unyielding Resolve
level_feats.text: Ignore the first Wound you would suffer each encounter (when Wounded abilities, such as Kinetic Momentum, still trigger).

level_feats.name: Reverberating Strikes
level_feats.text: You learn to focus your energy and transfer it as an additional concussive force into your foes. Add LVL bludgeoning damage to all of your melee attacks.

level_feats.name: Infuse Strength
level_feats.text: Make an unarmed strike against an ally and infuse them with a portion of your own strength instead of harming them. Expend any number of Hit Dice and heal them as you would heal yourself during a Field Rest (roll them and add your STR to each).

level_feats.name: Swift Feet (2)
level_feats.text: Gain an additional +2 speed as long as you are unarmored.

level_feats.name: Unyielding Resolve (2)
level_feats.text: Ignore the first 2 Wounds you would suffer each encounter.

level_feats.name: Iron Defense (2)
level_feats.text: Your armor is doubled while unarmored.

level_feats.name: Unyielding Resolve (3)
level_feats.text: Ignore the first 3 Wounds you would suffer each encounter. You have advantage on STR saves while Dying.

level_feats.name: Epic Boon
level_feats.text: Choose an Epic Boon (see pg. 23 of the GM's Guide).

level_feats.name: Windborne
level_feats.text: +1 to any 2 of your stats. +1 additional burst of speed when you roll Initiative. Permanently gain 1 action (while Dying, you have a max of 2 actions).

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Airshift
Martial Arts Abilities.text: You cannot be Grappled while conscious. While moving, you may travel across all terrain as normal ground, ignoring all ill effects (e.g., walls/ceilings, water, treetops, lava, spikes, clouds).

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Blur
Martial Arts Abilities.text: When you Defend, you may first move up to half your speed away, taking no damage if you are now out of range or have Full Cover.

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Bodily Discipline
Martial Arts Abilities.text: You may spend 1 action to end any non-Wound condition on yourself.

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Enduring Soul
Martial Arts Abilities.text: Each time you roll Initiative, gain Hit Dice equal to the actions you get on your first turn. These Hit Dice expire at the end of combat if unused.

Martial Arts Abilities.name: I Jump On His Back!
Martial Arts Abilities.text: While moving with your Windstep, if you move into the space of a creature your size or larger, you may jump onto its back. While on a creature this way, gain advantage on melee attacks against it, and any damage you avoid is dealt to it instead.

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Kinetic Barrage
Martial Arts Abilities.text: Whenever you miss an attack, gain a cumulative +STR bonus to all damage you do for the rest of this encounter (a disciplined martial artist does not miss on purpose).

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Mighty Soul
Martial Arts Abilities.text: You cannot be moved against your will. Whenever you would fail a saving throw, you may gain a Wound in order to add your STR to the result you rolled. You may repeat this any number of times.

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Quickstrike
Martial Arts Abilities.text: When you Interpose, you may first make an unarmed strike against the enemy for free.

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Use Momentum
Martial Arts Abilities.text: Whenever you avoid all of the damage of a melee attack (whether it misses or you Defend), you may swap places with the attacker and then choose another target that is now within the attack's reach, and they are hit instead.

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Vital Rejuvenation
Martial Arts Abilities.text: When you receive healing for the first time on a turn, you may heal another target within 6 spaces HP equal to your STR.

Martial Arts Abilities.name: Windstrider
Martial Arts Abilities.text: If you move through the space of a willing creature while using Windstep, they can move with you and choose any space adjacent to your path of movement to end in.

subclass_feats.name: Bring the Pain
subclass_feats.text: You may turn any melee attack against you into a crit. Whenever you are crit, reduce the damage by half. The attacker takes the same amount of damage you took (ignoring armor). You may suffer 1 Wound to double the damage the enemy takes.

subclass_feats.name: Share My Pain
subclass_feats.text: Your Swiftstrike can also target a 2nd creature within Reach 2.

subclass_feats.name: Pain Sharpens the Mind
subclass_feats.text: While you are Bloodied, gain advantage on the first attack you make each turn, and on all saves.

subclass_feats.name: Echoed Agony
subclass_feats.text: Your Swiftstrike can also target a 3rd creature within Reach 4.

subclass_feats.name: Exploding Soul
subclass_feats.text: On your turn, you may suffer a Wound. Whenever you gain a Wound, deal STR+Wounds damage to any creatures you choose within 2 spaces (ignoring armor) and give them the Smoldering condition.

subclass_feats.name: Blazing Speed
subclass_feats.text: Gain +2 speed while using Windstep. After you cease movement with Windstep, enemies you passed through take STR+DEX fire damage. You may have Smoldering enemies take double, ending the condition.

subclass_feats.name: Chain Reaction
subclass_feats.text: When you crit, deal fire damage equal to your STR+Wounds to creatures of your choice within 2 spaces of your target. Repeat any number of times, targeting creatures not yet damaged by this effect within 2 spaces of any already damaged.

subclass_feats.name: Burning Soul
subclass_feats.text: Double any fire damage you deal.
